title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 6 ยง 663.6 - Continuance of interim permits; pending applications
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 6 ยง 663.6 - Continuance of interim permits; pending applications

State Regulations

At the time of this Part becomes effective in a
particular area, some persons in that area will have already obtained wetlands
interim permits or will have applied for them in accordance with the
department's freshwater wetlands interim permit regulations (Part 662 of this

Title). (a) A person who has already
obtained an interim permit for a particular project may rely on it, and need
not obtain any additional permit or letter of permission under this Part, except as described in subdivision (b) of this section. If the project for
which the permit was issued is located in a village, town, city or county which
has adopted a local law or ordinance and is implementing the act in accordance
with section 24-0501 of the act and Part 665 of this Title, no additional
permit for the project will be required under that local legislation, but the
commissioner will forward to the local government a copy of the interim
permit. (b) Upon receipt of an
application for renewal or extension of an interim permit, the department may, as per section
621.11
of this Title, treat such a
renewal or extension as a new application under Part 663. Furthermore, the
department may modify, suspend or revoke such an interim permit pursuant to
section
621.13
of this Title. (c) If an application for an interim permit
has been submitted for a proposed project and a decision on that application
has not been made at the time this Part becomes effective, the department will
retain regulatory jurisdiction over that application and will treat the
application as an application for a permit or letter of permission under this

Part. Accordingly, additional information may then be required in order to
comply with this Part. (d) If the
proposed project described in subdivision (b) or (c) of this section is located
in a village, town, city or county which has assumed regulatory authority
pursuant to section 24-0501 of the act and Part 665 of this Title, the
department staff will consult with the local government prior to making a
decision on the application. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 6
ยง
663.6

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
